RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 16 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In El igibility And Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COMMERCIAL FLASH settled at the rear in the three path, moved forward between horses entering the lane, split foes while tipping three wide in upper stretch, rallied in pursuit of the clear leader in the final furlong, drove past that one at the sixteenth pole, and kicked clear. BET ON BOURBON stalked along the inside, bid for the lead through an opening inside of the top pair entering the lane, drew clear in upper stretch, but was caught by an outer oncharging foe entering the final sixteenth. ENDURING PEACE chased from midpack in the four path around the turn, came into the lane in the six path, but was outkicked by an inner rival while chasing in upper stretch, and kept on for a minor share. KASEN'S SISTER lacked speed while hung in the five path around the turn, fanned to the seven path entering the lane, and moved up while hanging on her left lead. AMERICAN REBEL bumped with an inner rival at the start, settled far back in the two path, shifted three wide approaching the furlong grounds, and improved position. GILDED APPLE made contact with an outer rival at the start before receiving a brush from an inner foe soon after, chased from midpack while under urging and saving ground, but failed to factor. CANDY'S PRIDE dueled for the lead inside of a rival while a path off of the inside, which allowed for her to be headed by a rail bidder at the quarter pole, then caved between horses. CHARLIE'S PEAK brushed an outer rival soon after the start, dueled for the lead outside of a foe while kept in the three path around the turn by that rival, then weakened in the four path and between horses at the quarter pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Bet On Bourbon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rail bid 1/4, drew clear, caught 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Candy's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside foe-2p, headed 2w1/4, caved btwn

ENTRY.NAME: Gilded Apple
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump/brushed start, chased midpack inside, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: American Rebel
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, far back ins-2p, 3w1/8, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Kasen's Sister
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 5p, 7p1/4, left lead, moved up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE'S JERSEY TUFF stalked three wide, pressed the leader from the three path around the turn, briefly failed to keep pace entering the lane, yet sustained a chase thereafter, began to close in once more in the final furlong, bid in the final sixteenth, and edged clear. KEEP LEFT vied for the lead two wide, led into the turn, showed the way in the two path around the bend as an outer rival pressed, inched clear entering the lane, maintained a margin through midstretch, but met her outer counterpart's re-challenge a sixteenth from home, and was bested late. HIGHER NOTE vied for the lead along the inside, rated back to stalk entering the turn, then only managed to chase along the rail through the lane. CORONA DEL MAR chased the leader from the three path, but gave way while hanging on her left lead. SWEETASBAILY was coaxed along while racing off of the pace and in the two path into the turn, shifted out to the five path in upper stretch, and lacked a rally. MARIA GONE WILD broke slowly, trailed around the bend, and never got involved. LITTLE FAIRY broke a step slow and brushed the outer part of the gate at the start, then lacked speed in the four to five path around the turn, and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Fairy
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow start/brushed gate, off pace 4-5p turn, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetasbaily
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside, coaxed along 2p, 4-5p upr, lacked rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Claiming Purse 24000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARNELIAN bumped with an inner rival at the start, stalked the clear leader from the three path, took aim outside of her in upper stretch, but drifted out at the three sixteenths pole, corrected and sustained a bid at the furlong grounds, and drove clear. ONE MORE LAUGH set a clear pace in the two path, held sway through upper stretch, but met a rival's bid at the furlong grounds, and was bested entering the final sixteenth. CHROME RACER raced at the rear two to three wide, then rallied between horses to gain show at the furlong grounds. JACKIE FLASH lacked speed in the five path, and ran on while one paced through the lane. TERRANOVA tracked in the four path, but yielded between horses in the final furlong. WAR ENSIGN bumped an outer rival at the start, raced at the rear along the inside, and made little impact. BALI DOVE (FR) tracked along the inside, but faded. DUXONTHEPOND laid off of the pace two wide, and weakened between horses entering the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: War Ensign
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, at rear inside, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Carnelian
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump st, stalked 3p, aim upr, drifted out 3/16, bid 1/8, cleared

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Racer
ENTRY.COMMENT: at rear 2-3wd, rallied btwn upr, up show 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Terranova
ENTRY.OWNER: Vanier Nancy A Williamson Lyda DP Alliance Racing LLC and Horseplayers Racing Cl

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 51000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $17,500. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Rac es At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500 (Races Where Entered For $40,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $40,000 In Their Last 3 Starts).

CLAIM.OWNER: Michael Thomas Allen Jeff W Weiter Joseph A and Habeeb Donald J

RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROYAL TAKE CHARGE stalked outside of the pace setter, inched closer to press into the far turn, ranged up to vie entering the lane sparking a duel, battled determinedly through the lane, wrestled an advantage in the final furlong, and edged away in the final sixteenth. NON VIOLENCE set the pace while in hand around the first turn, showed the way around the far turn as an outer foe applied pressure, met that foe's bid entering the lane, dueled while gamely clinging to an advantage through midstretch, but was headed in the final furlong, and gave in a sixteenth from home. ZING trailed along the inside, improved inside of rivals into the far turn, gained show from a tiring foe at the quarter pole, and evened out without threatening the leading pair. CHAMPAGNE AFFAIR bumped with an inner rival at the start, tracked in the three path, but faded in the four to five path around the far turn. FINE COTTON got rank entering the first turn, stalked behind the leader while pulling in the bit, chased the top pair from the three path around the far turn, but weakened entering the lane. JUDY'S WAY bumped an outer rival at the start, lacked speed in the four path, trailed in the five path around the far turn, and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Fine Cotton
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, stalked inside, pulled, chased 3p2nd, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Non Violence
ENTRY.OWNER: Martin Racing Stable LLC Gorsky Bob and Circustown Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, ins foe 2nd, dueled 1/4, game, gave in 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Judy's Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, off pace 4p, trailed 5p2nd, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Zing
ENTRY.OWNER: L. T. B., Inc. and Childers, Miles
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed ins, improved 3/8, up show 1/4, evened out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 52000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BASALT STREET tracked two wide and between horses, pursued from the three path around the turn, tipped outside of the leading trio leaving the quarter pole, rallied with a clear LAKE MARIE to catch in the final furlong, surged up to her nearing the wire, and prevailed at it. LAKE MARIE broke outwardly, set the pace in the two path, inched clear entering the lane, held sway into deep stretch, but got nailed at the wire. BOX OF PICTURES stalked along the inside, was pocketed around the turn, gained place from an outer rival entering the lane as the leader kicked clear, took aim outside of that one approaching the final furlong, but was outkicked for place while chasing the leader home. SHE'S GONE D'WILD took slight contact from rivals on either side at the start, lagged behind around the turn, came into the lane in the four path, and moved up between horses while hanging on her left lead. G'S SQUEEZE broke a step slowly at the start, tracked in the four path while outside of the top pair, but yielded between horses in midstretch. IRONIT was brushed by rivals on either start, lacked speed in the four to five paths, and gave way. HALF KOO KOO pressed the leader from the outside, chased in the three path around the turn, and weakened entering the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: G's Squeeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow start, tracked 3wd-4p, yielded btwn 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Lake Marie
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, set pace 2p, inched clear 1/4, held sway, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Ironit
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed btwn start, off pace 4-5p, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: She's Gone d'Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed btwn start,lagged behind,4p1/4,moved up btwn,left lead

ENTRY.NAME: Basalt Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2wd btwn,3p turn,tip 4wd upr,rallied,late bid,up at wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 52000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $13,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since N ovember 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Races Where Entered For $35,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UPHOLD THE LAW bumped with an outer rival at the start, stalked outside of the pace setter, pressed around the turn, bid entering the lane, dueled through upper stretch while neck-neck with the early pace setter, forged an advantage at the furlong pole, inched clear a sixteenth from home, and kept an outer bidder at bay. OMAHA RED stalked three wide, chased the top pair while not progressing through upper stretch, began to close in nearing the final sixteenth as the new leader edged away, sustained a grinding charge in hopes of producing a late bid, but did not have enough. HIGHER STANDARD set the pace along the inside, felt pressure from an outer rival around the turn, dueled with that foe entering the lane, sparred gamely through upper stretch, but was headed at the furlong grounds, and yielded at the sixteenth pole. BROKEN RIB settled far back in the two path, and moved up between horses in midstretch. AWE SHACKLE laid off of the pace in the four path, and failed to factor. RUSSIAN TANK bumped with an inner rival at the start, trailed two wide, and was outrun. HUNTER JOHN stalked along the inside while tugging under a firm hold early on, and weakened entering the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Hunter John
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, firm hold early, wknd 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Higher Standard
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell David E Arnold Douglas S Winston Marc and Clement David
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, ins foe turn, dueled 1/4, headed 1/8, yielded 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Uphold the Law
ENTRY.OWNER: Brennan Niall J and Moulton Susan

ENTRY.NAME: Omaha Red
ENTRY.OWNER: Wolfe Racing LLC and Robertson, Hugh H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3wd, chased upper, grind late, bid, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Broken Rib
ENTRY.OWNER: David A Bernsen LLC and Bayou Bengal Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 7 1 1/16M Turf CR: 78. Maiden Special Weight Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $50,000 In Their Last 3 Starts). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 34 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GIRL NAMED CHARLIE bobbled and bumped an outer rival at the start, then took back when put to tight quarters between horses soon after, settled far back along the inside, pursued in hand in the four path around the far turn, moved forward between horses entering the lane, but encountered a wall of traffic while taking a brush from an outer rival leaving the quarter pole, shifted in for clear sailing in upper stretch, offered a good kick to surge past the leaders at the furlong grounds, and was driven home to seal the deal. JUST SAY SO settled off of the pace three wide, then five wide around the far turn, floated to the seven path entering the lane, rallied in the final furlong while lugging in slightly, yet sustained her charge to bid for place late, and narrowly prevailed. BEST PERFORMER tracked three wide, got floated to the five path at the quarter pole while producing a bid, but was outkicked by an inner rival at the three sixteenths pole, chased that rival through the final furlong, but was caught at the wire for place. DON'T GO CHANGING broke a step slowly before taking a bump from an inner rival at the start, trailed in the three path, moved out of last six wide around the far turn, shifted out to the eight path in upper stretch, and moved up late. PAINT ME PERFECT tracked in the two path, shifted four wide into t he far turn, came into the lane in the six path, leaned inwardly leaving the quarter pole to shut the door on an inner rallying rival, then lacked a kick himself thereafter. AUDACIOUSNESS stalked two wide, bid for the lead while floated to the four path and between horses at the quarter pole, but was outkicked by rivals on both sides in upper stretch, and faltered coming to the furlong grounds. LA PERLA NERA saved ground off of the pace, but failed to respond to urging around the far turn, and faded. GOLDEN STAR severely resisted restraint while showing the way through the lane for the first time, pulled away to a clear margin around the first turn, shifted out as a pair of rivals bid entering the lane, and was swallowed up between horses at the three sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Audaciousness
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2wd, 4p btw 1/4, bid, outkicked btw 3/16, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Paint Me Perfect
ENTRY.OWNER: Low, Lawana L. and Robert E.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Buck Pond Farm Inc and Seale Richard M
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, pulled clear, off rail 1/4, swallowed btw 3/16

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Go Changing
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow/bump start,trail 3p,6w2nd,8p upr,moved up late

ENTRY.NAME: Best Performer
ENTRY.OWNER: Kirk Kat and Sanders Wayne R
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3wd, bid 5p1/4, outkicked 3/16, nailed for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RISKTAKER vied for the lead two wide and between horses, then inside of a trio of rivals after an inner foe faltered into the turn, shook clear entering the lane, and held sway. MR. CROMWELL tracked in the five path, gained place at the three sixteenths pole, and was second best. MINE YOUR BIZ broke in and bumped a rival at the start, lacked speed in the three path, then stayed on in the six path. PARTY LITTLE BOY bumped an outer rival at the start, rushed to vie for the lead five to four wide into the turn, but failed to keep pace with his innermost counterpart entering the lane, lugged in while flopping back to his left lead at the furlong grounds, and weakened. IRON FORTUNE was bumped and crowded by rivals on both sides at the start, raced far back along the inside, and improved along the fence. DIGNIFIED N KRAFTY vied for the lead four to three wide and among foes, but gave way turning for home. LIT A SHUCK sparred for the lead briefly inside of a host of rivals, but faded entering the turn. LANDRY AND LUCAS bumped with an outer rival at the start, dueled three to two wide and between horses, but weakened at the five sixteenths pole. OAK HILL MO broke in and bumped a foe at the start, and got outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Risktaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2wd btw, ins trio turn,cleared 1/4, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Cromwell
ENTRY.OWNER: Pratt Jr James M Goodson John and Stall Jr Albert M

ENTRY.NAME: Iron Fortune
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped btwn start, far back ins, rail improvement

ENTRY.NAME: Mine Your Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in/bump start, off pace 3p, 6p upr, stayed on
